markdownRemark.html:
Conventions

RTT: round trip time

Definitions

  • Socket API: the interface for passing data between the application and transport layer
  • Client process: process that initiates communication
  • Server process: process that waits to be contacted

  • Port number: part of a routing address which determines which process receives data (IP address determines which host)

    • HTTP port 80. HTTPS port is 443. SMTP/mail port is 25. DNS port is 53.
    • Destination ports are fixed by protocol, source ports on client can be anything [0,65535]

  • TCP service:

    • Reliable transport
    • Flow control: sender won't overwhelm receiver
    • Congestion control: throttle sender when network overloaded
    • No timing, throughput or security guarantees
    • Connection-oriented: setup required beterrn client and server preferences

  • UDP service:

    • Unreliable transport

  • Round-trip time: time for a small packet to travel client-server then server-client

    • Propagation delay, processing delay, and queueing delay for both directions

Theorems

  • Transport Layer protocols have different guarantees, pros and cons

    • Data integrity, low delay, high throughput, security/encryption
  • A
